Sentencas: In the present study the gelcasting process was applied to formation of ceria membranes from nanopowders derived from a reverse microemulsion technique as well as from commercial microcrystalline powders.

Sentencas: It was found that morphology of the starting powders, characterized by N-2-BET (low temperature nitrogen adsorption) and DLS (dynamic light scattering) methods, was a key-parameter influencing the membrane properties formed in the gelcasting process.
